column1: good length on off stump, defended on the front foot. No movement on that first ball
good length on off stump, defended into the point region with the outside half
back of a length and slanted across off stump, he opens the face and steers to third man for the first run
good length and in at leg stump, allows it to come on and flicks to fine leg's left
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side from the crease
good length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
back of a length on off stump, tapped to point from the crease
back of a length in the corridor, looks to chop it to third man and under-edges to the keeper
good length on off stump and a confident drive on the up, straight to mid-off
shot. Another length ball on off stump, and he offers the full face to punch this past Amla on the up. No swing, no seam movement. Through the line and to the boundary
good length and in at off stump, tucked into the leg side from the crease
good length and in at off stump, dead-batted into the pitch with a closed face
back of a length just outside off, Amla right on top of the bounce as he punches this with ease through the covers
good length and just outside off, late on bringing the bat down. No feet at all. Big inside edge to fine leg
good length outside off stump, dropped into the off side with soft hands
back of a length outside off, sliced to third man off the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, solidly behind to defend this on the back foot
shot. By far the fullest ball he's bowled today, but he still can't find swing. This is full outside off and Amla drives wide of mid-off
good length and just outside off, taps it on the up to point
back of a length just outside off, hangs the bat out and gets an inside edge into the thigh
good length just outside off, defended solidly into the off side
good length on off stump, tapped to mid-on on the up
outside edge towards short cover. Looking to jab on the front foot, but that straightens from a length outside off
crack goes the whip! Bumrah falters on the slower ball. It's wide and short enough for QDK to adjust to the variation and dismiss this with a flat bat, through the covers
extra bounce as he looks to guide this to third man. Kicks up from a good length and he's struck on the gloves
good length and in at leg stump, deflected to square leg off the pad as he looks to flick
good length and just outside off.Taps it into the off side and is denied another single by Amla. '100% run out hoga' (100% he's going to be run out) is the chatter from someone in the infield
good length on off stump, defended to point on the front foot
short of a length just outside off, driven on the up, straight to mid-off
good length on off stump, defended solidly from the crease
good length on off stump, defended solidly into the covers on the front foot
full and just outside off, hangs tall in the crease and opens the face. Classic Amla. Gets it off the low end but it's good enough to race away through cover point
back of a length on off stump, watchfully pushed into the leg side
hits the shoulder of the bat after climbing at him. Sails over the vacant slip region. That was a length ball he was looking to defend
good length and in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and in at leg stump. Flicks with the angle, straight to square leg
good length and just outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
good length and just outside off, drives on the up through cover. Virat Kohli gives chase, puts in a dive and his knee plonks into the turf. He's limping now. The ill-effects of intertia
ouch. Walks at the bowler and looks to launch him over midwicket with a pull. Gets a top edge that catches him on the chin

oh what a glorious shot. Full and wide outside off. Full swing of the bat with a big stride. Gorgeous. But point is back at the boundary and will have lost an opportunity if he didn't smile creepily at the batsman as he fields
leading edge clears the infield on the off side. Early on the shot as he looks to flick the length ball on the leg side
full ball just outside off, driven firmly to mid-off's left but can't beat his dive
full ball on off stump, drilled back at the bowler who does unbelievably well to field in his follow through. They're flying off his bat now
good length and in at leg stump, pushed through square leg

given lbw! Amla has missed one that's angled in. Full ball, angled in at off stump. Oh hang on, this could be a no-ball...nope, he gets the benefit of doubt. Very very close from Bumrah. Unlike the lbw decision, he's plumb there. Beaten by pace more than anything, late on the attempted drive
another lbw appeal but Faf has got an inside edge on this. Looks similar to the previous ball, with the angle in. But there is clear bat on this. Plumb otherwise, right in front of off
good length outside off, steered to third man
good length and in at off stump, defended into the off side
good length just outside off, watchfully defended on the front foot
full outside off, nice looking cover drive but he can't beat extra cover
good length and in at middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease

pierces the field this time. Nicely played. Good length outside off stump, leans into this. Never going to get to the pitch, but it's coming on so well. Steers it wide of mid-off. Kohli running...unlike himself over there. Can't cut it off
short of a length on off stump, swivels and pulls over midwicket. Never wanted to keep that down
nudges it through first slip where there used to be someone. A wide-open site there now. Faf picks the length early outside off, hangs back and uses his wrists to find another boundary
overpitched on leg stump, drilled to mid-on
overpitched wide outside off, nicely to the pitch and a beautiful swing of the bat through the line. Bisects mid-off and extra cover
short of a length outside off, cut to deep point
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut to cover point. That didn't come on as quickly as he anticipated
good length and in at leg stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease
short and wide outside off, thumped on the up to deep point
good length slider on off stump, tapped into the covers off the back foot
good length and turning away outside off, hangs back and flicks against the turn through square leg
..and he's immediately jumping into the leg side as QDK gets down early and allows this loopy ball outside off to come on, setting up for the lap sweep. Connects and gives Rohit work at long leg
short and wide outside off, punches it straight to cover
good length on middle stump, pushed into the leg side
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length and in at leg stump. Shovelled towards short fine and they complete the single despite a direct hit
good length skidder on off stump, turned to deep square from the crease
chips towards long-on as this stops on him. It's angled into him. Short of a good length. Looks to drive and it dribbles down to the fielder
back of a length just outside off, dabbed behind point with soft hands
offcutter dropped short and very wide. QDK hammers it to sweeper's left
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
beats him in flight and finds the inside edge. Some natural variation too. Pushes on the front foot and this goes straight through. Tickled to short fine
good length and just outside off, pushed through the covers with the turn
good length on off stump, defended on the back foot
loopy full ball outside off, can't squeeze the drive through cover. Followed the drift with his hands
full toss on off stump and he narrows his options early after premeditating the lap sweep. It rolls pitchside on the leg side
good length and in at leg stump. Appeal for lbw as another one doesn't turn. But this one is going down with the angle, hitting him in front of leg
ohhh yes. That's the QDK we know. Steps out, walks into the line of the ball, a short of a length delivery outside off, and wafts it behind square with too much power for anyone to stop that
no-ball call rings around the ground as Kuldeep cleans up to his left at third man. It's a short and wide ball outside off and he slices it deftly
misses out. Backs away and gets a generous length ball on the legs. Swings hard and misses, it thuds into the thigh guard
oh gorgeous. It's injustice to only get two for that. Short of a length outside off, gets on top of the bounce and swivels as he pulls this between deep square and fine leg

and this is not a gorgeous shot. Nowhere close. He might not even have got bat on it, actually. Steps out to a short ball outside, makes an ugly hoick across the line and misses. Dhoni let's it through from between his legs and third man can't cut it off
yes, back to stylish. Stands tall on this outside off. It's short and he has so much time to hammer it wide of mid-off from the back foot
back of a length just outside off, punched straight to extra cover off the back foot
tossed up on middle stump, gets low and meets it on the full. Paddles it fine again
tossed up outside off, nice loopy full ball. Driven straight to extra cover
tossed up outside off, driven to long-on
good length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
full on leg stump, driven to long-on

this looks good for India! Yes, it's given! Chahal pushes one flat at a leg stump line. It's pitching in line too. He looks to flick but he misses. Little doubt in this as it appears. De Kock won't even discuss a review. DRS however shows the ball would be spinning past leg stump
plenty of flight for his first ball on tour and Faf whips it powerfully enough that midwicket ends up misfielding
defends from the crease as Kuldeep bowls a good length ball on middle and off
shapes to flick a fullish delivery on middle and leg through midwicket, but the turn beats him. Minor lbw appeal but it would miss leg stump
doesn't pick the googly and after stopping it, barely, by his bottom edge, it nearly rolls through between his legs and onto the stumps
wrong un again and Markram is beaten on the outside edge. Lovely bowling from Kuldeep, tossing it up, lining it wider, pulling the batsman forward and nearly having him stumped
positions himself in front of all three stumps and works the well-flighted delivery in front of square leg. End of a fine over from Kuldeep
hangs back to a very full delivery and has to hurry into bringing down a straight bat
keeps it wicket to wicket and as such, even though Markram is desperate to get extra time, hanging out deep in his crease, he can't get any power on the flick
full and wide, and that line draws Markram forward. A drive to cover

run-out appeal and du Plessis may be in trouble! The South African captain puts in a full-length dive and stays prone on the ground for a while, seemingly suggesting he isn't confident of making his ground. Replays however show he's safe. And that he took his time getting up because he make have tweaked something. Punch to cover, risky single taken by a new batsman put under immense pressure by India's spinners. Durban's become Delhi
good length ball on middle and off, du Plessis pushes it back down the pitch
backs away and cuts a flatter delivery outside off through to sweeper cover
drives to long-off
gets forward to a tossed up delivery on middle and blocks it
nice and full outside off, he drives to cover
pulls his length back and Markram has a simple job punching it to long-on
hits against the turn, but since it is slow turn, Faf is able to pull off the cut shot to cover
full face of the bat and a high elbow on show as he punches the ball off the back foot to long-on
not full enough to drive, not short enough to pull, all Markram can do is flick it to midwicket
loops it up on leg stump, Markram drives to long-on
taps a shortish delivery, turning into the right-hander, through cover
short enough that Markram can stand up tall in his crease and drill it to long-on
though there is flight on this ball, Faf remains happy to play off the back foot - it's a slow pitch, it allows him that luxury - and he finds a single through square leg
well flighted on off stump, Markram defends
gives it a lot of air to bring Faf forward and out comes the drive to long-off
strides forward, but can't get anywhere near the pitch. Markram adjusts his batswing, keep it straight as well to pick up a single to long-on
lashes it to cover, but there's an extra man brought up to save the single
loops it up, but the line goes awry, allowing Faf a flick off the legs to the right of midwicket
a firm push to long-on as he gets a long stride forward, all but reaching the pitch of the legbreak
inviting delivery - the ball drifting away in the air, seemingly offering room to drive against the turn. But Faf is happy not to tempt fate
forces a very full delivery - having sneaked deep into the crease - down to long-on
a rare short ball that the batsman can rock back and cut. India have protection at sweeper cover though
advances at the leggie, who gets enough drift in at the batsman that Faf ends up cramped as he drives to long-off

caught at midwicket! Good work from Pandya, running to his left to intercept a pretty hard-hit flick. Markram would have expected a lot of runs for that shot, having charged down the pitch and picking up the ball on the half-volley. As it turns out, however, he's forced to walk back.
tries to knock a slow, good length delivery to the right of leg slip. And though he does that, he prefers not to take a risk for just a run
almost pops it back to the bowler, advancing down the pitch but finding himself in trouble as Chahal gets the ball to dip and turn before he can make contact with the bat
goes searching for the ball on the front foot again and mistimes the shot back to the bowler
whips a full delivery on middle and leg through midwicket
brings out the sweep, with the ball full and a shade outside off
goes back to try and slap the ball through cover. But he doesn't have enough room to generate any power
shifts back and across with the ball and taps it towards point
good length ball on and around off stump, forces it to extra cover
around the wicket, in hopes of cramping the left-hander, but Jadhav sends down a rank long hop. Duminy picks it up early and flays it through cover
very round-arm, with the line just outside off, but the change in action means the ball barely bounces. Good on Duminy to present a straightish bat
full toss on off stump, Duminy nails the cover drive
spears a shortish delivery outside off - the arm going very slingy - and Duminy pushes to cover
Malinga bowling offspin, and Duminy carves it through point
over the wicket to the right-hander, and du Plessis clips it through midwicket
backs away and pushes a shortish delivery outside off to long-off
steps forward to block a 79 kph tossed up googly on off stump
looks for the drive, but the ball turns just enough that Duminy skews it out to Kohli at cover
comes forward to block on middle and off
shortish and outside off, chops it through to deep point
he shapes for the cover drive, even making room to go inside out. But Kuldeep's drift, dip and turn makes sure the ball pings off the inside half of the bat down to long-off
full on off stump, defends
goes for the paddle sweep, taking a full delivery from off stump and sending it down to long leg
the offbreak, delivered off a remarkably slingy action, so the length ball barely rises. Duminy cuts through cover
he's starting to crouch as well in addition to slinging the ball through - meaning the ball comes down from a very low height. Faf pushes through cover
good length, outside off, slaps through to sweeper cover
beautiful drift into the left-hander, the ball also pitches before the batsman can reach it with his stride, on off stump, and therefore leaves Duminy with little option but the block
good length, on off stump, defends
drives inside out to long-off
hangs back against a good length ball and chops it to cover. He risks the single, but gets through, beating one of India's better fielders - Pandya

doesn't pick the googly and that makes it all the more special for Kuldeep. He pitches the ball a shade short, on and around off stump - step one of the plan. Step two depends on the batsman. If he spots the variation, he would play with a straight bat. Duminy doesn't. He thinks he can cut it away for runs. And the moment, he gets in position for that, he's in danger. Making things worse for him is that the ball skids through fairly low and knocks middle back middle stump
loops it up on off stump, and it's the googly again. Miller lunges forward and props a straight bat up so far in front of his body
crouches in his action, thrusts the arm low and wide and sends down a full ball on middle. Faf blocks
backs away, trying to put pace on this slow, shortish delivery on off stump. Can only get a single at cover
full and a shade outside off, with that slingy action. Miller defends
a hint of flight and Miller exploits it brilliantly. Gets a big stride down and slog sweeps it to smithereens
quicker delivery on middle and leg, punches it back to the bowler
short and wide - and fairly quick too - and Miller slices it to deep point
cracks it through cover, making room to flay a ball that does certainly turn off the pitch. But since it's slow, he's able to adjust and time it superbly. Fifty up for the South Africa captain
full and outside off, drives to long-off
full and outside off, he drives to long-off
taps a good length ball on top of off stump through cover. They pinch a single, and Miller gets struck on the ankle for taking the trouble

Kohli claims the catch and now it's over to the umpires. Ian Gould's soft signal is out. Lets see. Replays show conclusively that he's right. Good effort from the Indian captain, diving forward and scooping the ball up just as it dies on him. But the better one was from Kuldeep, in the way he drew Miller forward, forcing him to play away from the body. Beautiful work from the wristspinner, bowling slow and backing himself to beat his opponents in the air
full and outside off, he drives to mid-off
pitches it up a shade outside off and there is just enough seam off the pitch that a nervous du Plessis gets an inside edge onto pad
again, he angles the ball into the right-hander, fairly steeply, and Faf's flick becomes an inside edge onto pad as well
fuller delivery on off stump, du Plessis knocks it down to long-on
short and wide, Morris slaps it to point
there's his specialty - the short ball, at the batsman's body. Morris defends
drives on the up to mid-off
bunts a good length ball on leg stump to long-on
full on middle and leg, Morris sweeps to long leg
hangs back, lets the shortish delivery turn, and hits with it to the sweeper cover
sets up to launch this - very wide outside off - out of the ground. But eventually doesn't even play a shot
fires it in quick on middle, looking for lbw, but Morris manages to survive it. This is such skillful bowling - rather execution
googly, on middle and off, Morris clips to midwicket
rides a shortish delivery just outside off through to point
fullish on off stump, pushes to mid-off
blocks a back of a length delivery outside off
uses a closed face to guide the shortish delivery outside off to short midwicket
punches a back of a length delivery on middle to long-on
waits on the good length ball to come to him and steers it to the right of point. Again, when Pandya is pitching it up, he seems to get the tiniest curl in at the right-hander
stands up tall and punches a back of a length delivery to the right of short cover. Pandya does well to get down to it
hangs back against a good length ball and slices it to the sweeper cover
defends the good length ball on off stump

beats him outside off! A good length ball, tagged with a little width to tempt the loose shot. Additionally, Bumrah almost always angles the ball into the right-hander, and here he somehow manages to get it to straighten. Beautiful
back of a length and outside off, blocks
looks for the blockhole, the angle into the right-hander so very steep as well. Morris digs it out
gets struck on the hip as he goes for the flick, but Pandya's angle, and a smidge of extra pace foils those plans.
extra bounce as Pandya hits the deck and a short and wide delivery becomes an absolute jaffa. Beats the cut shot by a foot
on middle and off, he waits for the ball and redirects it to deep square leg
stands up tall against the short ball outside off and cracks it through to the sweeper cover
inside edge! A bit of a nothing shot from du Plessis, trying to glide a back of a length delivery too close to his body somewhere behind point. Instead, he gets four through fine leg
turns a fuller delivery on off stump to deep square leg
good length and speared in at off stump, defended into the leg side
full ball at off stump, steps out and yorks himself. Too much force on the ball for him to open up and connect on the cover drive that he attempts. Ball dribbles to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, steals a single in front of point with the use of soft hands
short and wide outside off and he clatters this to sweeper cover with a cut
full toss just outside off, tapped to sweeper cover

shot. Morris has hit so many sweet-sounding punches today for hardly any runs. The one that finally fetches him a four is not so well connected. But it gets him four. Picks the length early and plays a short arm pull over midwicket

expertly done by Faf. Allows the ball to come in with the angle and tickles it wide of short fine off middle stump. Bumrah gives chase and leaves the dive too late. Would have done damage to himself if he went in when he thought about it. Let it go in the end
good length on middle stump, dabbed to short fine and now the steal a single from Bumrah
bludgeoned. Short ball outside off and he's been punished every time he's hit that length. Morris plants the front leg across and swings to find the wide long-on boundary
good length and just outside off, defended on the back foot
good length on middle stump, squeezed to deep midwicket from the crease
inside edge onto thigh as he looks to flick another one fine. Looking to use that angle once more, doesn't succeed this time
short and wide outside off, reaches out and chops from under the ball. Clears point but can't beat Kuldeep to his left at sweeper cover
slower ball at a length, just outside off. Punched to extra cover on the up

full and down leg side. He appears to have missed the flick. The umpire has called it wide. Only Kohli and Rohit think there's an edge. And the vice captain has convinced Kohli to review this for caught behind. Bowler and keeper aren't consulted - they didn't think it was close....and it wasn't. Not out, India lose the review
full and in at middle stump, driven to long-on on the up
Faf struck on the inside thigh and that's his quota of at least one ball into the mid-riff complete. He's arrived. Bumrah gets this to jag in and he's fending at it. Struck just under the thigh guard
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
misses his length on the yorker and Faf makes easy work of it with his stride. It becomes a full toss that he duly taps wide of sweeper cover
Rahane gets a fingertip at midwicket and he's lucky that's all he can manage. This is slaughtered from Morris. Short of a length outside off and out comes the pull shot again
good length on off stump, punched right off the middle to mid-off
good length on middle stump, punched on the up to the bowler who stops in his follow through
yorker on off stump, squeezed out to long-on
good length and just outside off. Mistimes the attempted punch through cover. Rolls out to the fielder there
beautiful. Steps out, meets the length all at the pitch with his body well out of the way. Makes plenty of room and drives it between bowler and mid-off
flipper on a length at leg stump. Hurriedly stabs it back to the bowler with no time for feet
drops it short and wide. Morris rocks back quickly and carts him wide of long-on with a pull. Got a little too much elevation on that. Came on slowly
full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
length on off stump, and he almost locks himself with the front foot stride. Bat comes out late from behind the pad and luckily for him, this turns away like he expects it
googly, back of a length and in at leg stump. Punched to long-on off the back foot
good length on off stump, late on the ball as he looks to punch towards long-on without getting to the pitch. Can't get it past the bowler
good length and just outside off, pushed back to the bowler on the front foot
gets the wrong'un as he shapes for the reverse sweep. But the bounce outside off means he cops it on the body
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-on
tossed up wide outside off, waits for it to turn and drives to long-off
floated full on middle stump, drives to long-off, inside-out
full on leg stump, checks his intent for a flick. Pushes to midwicket
good length and just outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover

beats the outside edge with a stunning legbreak. Drifted in full at off stump, he expects it to turn away and holds back on the shot. But he waits too late. Ball rips past. Dhoni breaks the stumps and it's sent upstiars. He's in.
back of a length at off stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot

Faf stretches his hamstrings, Kohli saves his face, and then Bumrah nearly lobs one into Pandya's nose. This is a very short and very wide ball outside off. Spinning past the wide marker but he reaches out and cuts. It lifts off dangerously as Kohli gets down to field at extra cover. Bumrah cleans up running to his left at long-off and lobs it at Pandya who doesn't expect it. Everyone's safe in the end
short ball outside off, drags it against the turn to deep square's left with a pull
whew, that sounds sweet. Echoes around the ground as Faf destroys this full ball at middle stump. Slog sweep executed to perfection, flat, on the bounce over the vacant region over there
full outside off, leans in and places this drive wonderfully to long-off's left

shot of the tour. This is glorious. Kuldeep floats another one up outside off. Morris reaches out and doesn't reach the pitch of it with a big stride. Stays leg side of it and creams it wide of long-off
good length on leg stump, pushed to square leg off the back foot

oh he should be fined half his IPL contract for that shot. Morris has looked completely assured, but he's completely missed this. It's a full toss on off stump, prime for a flogging anywhere in front of the stumps. But he's made a decision early to sweep. He's also through the shot much before the ball arrives. It all looks very ugly in the end, as the ball lands on the crease, spins in and tonks off stump. That looked a bit like someone was learning video game controls
good length just outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
good length on middle stump, defended solidly on the front foot
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
good length on middle stump, punched back to the bowler who fields one-handed to his left
slower ball dug in short at a middle stump line. He ducks under it
slower ball on leg stump, pushed into the leg side on the up
full toss just outside off, punched to long-on
googly, back of a length and ripping in at off stump. Backs away and pushes to extra cover
good length on off stump, watchfully pushed to extra cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's right
good length outside off, defended to extra cover with a big stride
short of a length and spinning in at off stump. Comes on slowly and he can't punch this past extra cover
full on middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
just clears deep square with a neatly connected slog sweep. Rahane at the boundary, not tall enough to get to that. Andile nails this, reaching wide outside off to swing
length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length on off stump, spins in and catches him on the pad as he beats his inside edge on the front foot
full toss on off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up on leg stump, gets down the track and shovels this to long-on off the inside half
back of a length just outside off, poked to extra cover from the crease
back of a length on leg stump, nudged to fine leg off the back foot
through his defence and over the stumps. Bumrah belts it in on a length and Faf is beaten on the inside edge as he looks to stab through the off side. Beaten by angle

run out chance but Kohli misses the stumps after swooping down quickly at extra cover. Length ball on off stump pushed straight towards him and it's a suicidal run. Kohli does everything right, but can't hit
yorker on middle stump, pushed into the leg side
low full toss on off stump, punched to long-off
short of a length and pushed wide outside off. Steps out and wafts, misses
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off from the crease
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left. Not timed too well, but that allows him a second
oh shot. Short and wide outside off again. Third man is in, point is in. Faf steers this nicely between them
short and wide outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
good length on off stump, punched to long-off from the crease
good length on the pads, can't get bat on the attempted glance, but he gets pad on it. And he gets to the other side

and they rise to their feet! Faf has nudged to square leg to bring up his 9th ODI century. A top-class innings from South Africa's captain. He's had to change gears constantly through this innings, but he's managed to get the ton in 101 balls
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length outside off, clips it to deep midwicket with his wrists
slower ball at a length, just outside off. Punched to sweeper cover
back of a length and following him as he makes room by moving down leg. Swivels and pull, but can't beat square leg. either side and that was four
yorker at off stump, exposes the stumps and toe-ends it into the covers. Excellent yorker

Rahane loses the ball in the sun and can't get under this at sweeper cover. Toe end of the bat from Faf as he steps out and is forced to stretch out at this length ball. The catch is there for the taking. But Rahane has to stop and allow it to plonk because the sun is in his eyes. The shades are on his head
full at off stump, driven to long-off

oh it's out of there! Wow! Offcutter, good length and in at middle stump. Steps out and is almost sprinting at the ball as it comes on slowly. Swings cleanly and sends it a long long way over deep midwicket
full toss on leg stump, drilled to long-on
yorker on off stump, slogged off the toe end to midwicket
nearly takes out Faf at the other end as he clobbers this low full toss down the pitch. Long-off can get to it though
oh dear. Woeful from Chahal at extra cover. Length ball outside off, punched hard and straight to the fielder. He can't stop it. Kohli is forced to cover at long-off

another! He's found a new way of hitting sixes, and it's working so well! Down the track in anticipation of the angle, and then he merely lifts it with the pace. Sensationall hitting. Bumrah follows him with a length ball and he sends it into orbit
in at leg stump and he squeezes this between long-on and deep midwicket. Comes back for the second
full toss on leg stump, cramped on the attempted full. Drags it out to long-on

swipes towards midwicket and gets a four at third man. Bumrah bowls length again, this time it's an offcutter. We've seen grip for the spinners and we see it for him now too. Climbs up as he swings and takes the top edge
legcutter, back of a length and wide outside off. Faf sees its in the slot for the punch over cover, but the deviation means he misses

holes out to long-off. High-ish full toss outside off. Looks to clobber it over extra cover again but that's tough to control when he has to reach out so much. Pandya settles under it and completes the catch. World class innings from Faf
slower ball, wide outside off. Mistimed drive to long-off
well bowled. Yorker at off stump. Can't do more than under-edge this to Dhoni's left
yorker again. Taken on the full and driven out to long-off with the toe end of the bat. Kohli fumbles but recovers quickly enough
slower ball pushed wide and he can't get bat on it. But he does manage to get Andile on strike. Dhoni picks up and throws to the bowler who is ready at the non-striker's end to flick the bails off
low full toss on leg stump, looks for the slog but it hasn't been his day. Gets it out to long-on and that'll be a tame end to the innings. Only five off the last over
back of a length and largely holds its line outside off, Rohit shoulders arms
pitched further up and attacking off stump, Rohit presses forward and defensively pats the ball to backward point
short, wide outside off, wide past the tramline. Sneaks past Rohit's reach as well
back of a length and Morkel explores the channel outside off, Rohit doesn't
full and angling in at off stump, Rohit presses forward, meets the pitch and pushes the ball up to mid-on
back of a length and holds its line outside off, ignored
full and slanting in at off stump, Rohit eyes up the leg side. Instead, he squeezes a leading edge to mid-off
full and angling away outside off, pushed up to mid-off off the front foot
back of a length and slanting away outside off, guided with the angle to square-ish third man - first runs off the bat for India
good length on a fourth-stump line, solidly blocked off the front foot
full and angling into a front-foot flick to square leg
back of a length, 142ks, Rabada hits the pitch hard. Rohit calmly blocks to cover
140ks short ball, hurled in at the ribs, Rohit is rushed into a hook. He ends up flapping the ball to square leg
short, wide, Rohit throws his bat at the ball and sends a thick outside edge to deep third man
off-stump yorker, jammed to midwicket for one
just short of a good length and angling into middle stump, Rohit swivels on the back foot and times a pull over square leg. Quality ball-striking. Rohit at his best
good length and just a shade outside off, no shot
pretty full and angling into leg stump, Rohit spoons a flick to square leg
outstanding ball from Morne Morkel to round out the over. Good length, angling in, and straightens away. Rohit plays for the angle and watches the ball run past the outside edge
chest-high short ball on middle stump, Dhawan controls a hook and sends the ball to the right of long leg
back of a length and angling away outside off, steered with the angle to backward point
good length and angling across off, Dhawan is rooted to the crease as he flashes an outside edge to third man
Rohit aims to drive it on the up but this is like a quick legcutter. Hits the pitch and seams away sharply past the bat
full and angling in, tapped to the off side
leg-stump half-volley, Rohit helps himself with a flick to the fine-leg boundary
full and wide outside off, this is all hand-eye coordination. Crunnnnnched straight to extra cover
too full and Morkel strays into the pads, Dhawan merrily flicks it to the midwicket boundary. SA serve up two half-volleys in three balls, and the India openers feast on it
full and wide outside off, caressed to the right of mid-off towards extra cover
back of a length and just a shade outside off, Rohit rides the bounce and lets the ball slide off the face to backward point
back of a length and pushed wider outside off, Rohit shelves the cut and lets it go
full and angling into off stump, punched past the left of the bowler, Miller throws himself to his right from mid-off to intercept the ball
back of a length and the ball hits the bat as opposed to bat hitting the ball. Blocked to the off side
back of a length and slanting into off stump, dabbed to backward point with soft hands
good length and just outside off, 150ks, Rohit doesn't care. He picks it up and hoists it over the top of mid-on
shorter, skids on off stump, Rohit hangs back and blocks
middle-stump full-toss, clipped straight to midwicket
very full and angling in on middle, squirted square on the off side via a leading edge
inside edge on the cut. No feet and it's quite wide outside off. Slow pitch too. QDK can't stop to his left and fine leg can't stop them from taking the second
good length on off stump, defended into the covers

taken by de Kock. An ugly hoick from Rohit. Length ball at off stump is always going to to rise when it's Morkel bowling. Rohit goes across the line and it sits in the pitch slightly. Enough bounce for him to get a top edge that will land in the gully region. Everyone makes way as the keeper calls loudly and takes an easy one
good length at off stump, defended with soft hands
good length on middle stump and he leans in nicely to ease this past the bowler with the full face. Adjusting for the lift off the surface by turning his wrists and he manages to beat mid-on
back of a length and thudding the thigh guard as he looks to play the glance
a mean, 148kph bouncer. Straight up at his throat and forces him to hop first ball. Kohli is up to it, defends with soft hands

Kohli jab outside off surfaces early, and the edge takes Faf's fingertips as he dives to his right at first slip. He's the only one in the cordon. 144kph from Rabada this time, zipping away in the corridor. Kohli jabs with an open face but survives
short ball on off stump, hurried defence on the back foot
full toss outside off, tapped into the covers with no timing
Dhawan's gloves and bat are by his body as he fends awkwardly at this bouncer on his ribs. Leaps and somehow manages to get a glove on this to get a boundary very fine
good length and just outside off, tapped to point on the up
good length on off stump, flicked straight to midwicket with the angle
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length just outside off. Opens the face and carves it straight to backward point

shot. Wonderfully check-drive from Kohli past the bowler. Length ball and steep in the corridor, but he's leaning into this and it's a short punch with the full face showing. High elbow for taste. Brilliant
back of a length on middle stump, pushed to square leg
short of a length and skidding through lower than he expects. He under-edges the cut into the pitch
good length ball just outside off and swinging in late. Dhawan offers no feet as he looks to slash through the off side. Gets an inside edge down to fine leg
good length and in at leg stump. Nips in and strikes him on the pad as he looks to flick. They steal a single as the umpire turns down the keeper's appeal
good length and lifting up outside off. Wafts and misses
short of a length and slanted across off stump, left alone
short of a length and just outside off. Thinks of the cut and leaves late
short ball on middle stump, pulls with control, finds fine leg
he finds the gap between gully and point. Short ball angled across him, and he places this nicely to pick up two to third man's left
overpitched and just outside off. Dhawan pulls out his best cover drive. It's hit so hard, extra cover can't stop it fully. Gets his hands on it though and sweeper cover can clean up
good length and just outside off. Walks into it and taps to sweeper cover
finds the gap square on the off side again. Chops this short ball to third man outside off. Tahir gets across and hurls in his discuss throw
good length just outside off, pushed to mid-off on the up

shottttttt. Dhawan gets up with the ball, which is dug in short in the corridor. Gets sufficiently under it and the pitch is slow enough for him to get his hands sorted under it. Ramps it to the third man boundary
full ball outside off. Driven towards long-off. Duminy lunges knee-first at extra cover to try and field this. Ball slams into the knee cap and lobs up to Tahir
full on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
dropped short outside off and there's no point fielder. Dhawan waits on is knee and cuts late for an easy boundary
full on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
back of a length just outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
dropped short outside off and Faf takes another blow on his fingers. Dhawan hammers the pull straight to him at midwicket
back of a length just outside off, guided to third man

inside edge saves Dhawan from the lbw but Markram has lit the stumps up at the other end to run him out! Dhawan is unhappy with his partner. He's six yards short. He was looking to flick this behind square with the angle and narrowly escaped being caught right in front of middle stump because of an inside edge. In the mean time, Kohli tried to steal a single as the ball rolled pitch side into the off side. Two people in the game are still alive to the possibilities at this point - Kohli at the non-strikers end and Markram at point. Dhawan isn't ready for this run but Kohli is already halfway down. In the frenzy of the noise and the visuals, he decides to run because he doesn't seem to have a choice. Markram picks up with one hand and finishes the throw perfectly
short of a length in the corridor, backs away and leaves
good length and wide outside off, left alone
whew, lovely shot. Length ball on off stump, flicks it with ease to find deep square
short of a length and just outside off. Defended off the back foot
good length, wide outside off stump. Leans in and drives to sweeper cover
full on middle stump, gets the bat in front of the pad and flicks straight to midwicket
full on leg stump, driven to long-on
full outside off, jammed to extra cover's right and they steal a run
nearly sneaks through and traps his back leg in front of middle stump. Length ball is a slider and Rahane goes on the back foot. Just manages to get bat on it
another slider. Back of a length on middle stump. Late on the pull. Inside edge onto pad
good length just outside off, tapped to point on the up
good length outside off, defended to point on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot

aerial pull with little control. But it's wide of midwicket. Short ball lifts up at his helmet and he swivels to pull this. A wild throw comes in from the deep and they get an overthrow through the non-striker's end

full outside off, driven to sweeper's right. Rahane respons to the call for the second. Morris' right thumb collides with the stumps and he's in some discomfort. On his feet now...oh in fact it's the ball that flicks the top of his thumb. Yikes.
bouncer outside off, left alone
good length just outside off, mistimed drive into the covers
full outside off, handsome drive past the bowler. Can't beat mid-off
skews it wide of fine leg as he can't make the pitch of this. Length ball angled in at him and he looks to punch. Spots Morkel at fine leg and immediately calls for the second. Makes his ground
good length and in at leg stump. Steps out and deflects into the leg side off his pad
short ball down leg side, looks to pull and can't get bat on it
good length and in at middle stump, punched to mid-on on the rise
full on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
attacks the top of off stump, but finds Rahane in the way

risky, with gully in place, and the ball only barely beats the man diving to his left. The short ball cramps Rahane, but he sways out of its way and attempts to carve it to third man. Such risk for a single run. Perhaps he thought the ball would bounce more...
strides forward to a back of a length delivery and as a result, he has to yank his bottom hand off to drive through cover
presses forward and drills a good length perfectly straight down the pitch. Almost connected the two sets of stumps

whoa!! That's a spectacular passage of play. Starts with a sensational straight drive, the full face of the bat meeting a perfectly good ball on off stump. The timing on it is second to nothing but Morris sticks his right hand out, fields the ball like a boss, and flings a throw at the striker's end because Rahane is thinking about a run
bangs it in short and Rahane stays away from it
has to leap up off his feet to ride the bounce of this short delivery outside off.
walks into the drive, and he realises he might be a little early on the shot and so does his best to check the push to cover. It's all in the wrist
steers it, having waited what seems like an age for the ball to come to him, away to third man.

outrageous! They've targeted the allrounder as the weak link of the attack. Little else can expain Rahane backing away and lashing a good length ball in line with the stumps over the covers like he's the godfather of all batting
back of a length on middle, Rahane nudges it into the leg side
on the pads and it's an easy put away to long leg
wild full toss outside off, Kohli prepares the cover drive, Miller fielding up inside the circle pulls off a special save, diving to his left. #GameOn
works it off middle and leg behind square leg
walks down the pitch, but Morris adjusts with a slower ball, hitting the deck and denying Kohli any room to work with. Extra bounce as well.
the line goes wrong in search of the yorker and Kohli dismisses it to the long leg boundary, deeming it poor enough that he'd play a shot with only one hand
keeps low and Kohli is able to jab the (straight) bat down in time to save his off stump
defends a good length ball outside off to point

the intention is to pick up a single, but hey, if you time it that well, the game gives you a bit more. He keeps coming at the bowler, walks at him, and so Morris indulges in a slower ball. It ends up overpitched and Kohli drills it to the right of mid-off
nudges the back of a length delivery towards short midwicket
all hands as he sends a ball just back of a length and outside off away to long-on. Pulling off a shot like that is in the balance, and hand-eye coordination
hares out of his crease and is upset by a bouncer. Goes for a hook, mistimes the shot badly, but square leg is deep and the chance for a catch goes to waste
waits on the shortish delivery and that helps him pick the gap to the right of midwicket
turns a good length ball on leg stump through to deep midwicket, bringing down a straight bat until the moment it makes contact. That's when the wrists come in and impart power
back of the hand slower ball skirts a little too far wide outside off
blocks it towards point, looking for a single, but his captain isn't interested
bottom hand whippage as Kohli leans over a flighted delivery on off stump. Single to long-on
sprints out of his crease as if it's last call for a big lunch and creams the good length ball - which becomes a half-volley - into the straight boundary
nudges the flatter delivery on middle through to deep square leg
looks for runs on the leg side again, preparing a whippy stroke, but the length isn't there. So he tucks the ball on off stump to square leg
stands tall and clips a short delivery on off stump to long-on
tosses it up on off stump, Rahane works it to short midwicket
short and wide outside off, and Kohli flays it behind point
prepares the cut, but the length is a touch fuller and so he bottom edges it to point
a hint of drift into the right-hander, keeping Rahane honest, and then when the ball turns thereafter, the batsman can only block it
skips out of his crease, but again, the lack of room doesn't allow Rahane too many scoring options
brings his wrists out to flick a full delivery on off stump to long-on
nicely tossed up on middle and off, Kohli pushes it past Tahir's left
shifts his weight back and flicks a good length ball on middle and leg through to deep midwicket. Brings up the fifty partnership
goes back to a ball he probably should have been forward, and a short-arm pull only goes as far as short midwicket. If he was any slower with the shot, he might have been lbw
walks into the shot as he drives to long-on
lunges forward to the pitch of the ball on off stump and directs it with a closed face to long-on

ventures out of his crease again but it's premeditated movement and as such the bowler can adjust. Duminy bowls quicker, pulls his length back, cramps Rahane and forces him to inside edge through midwicket
preempts the Indian captain coming down the track and slides it wide down leg

that's trademark! The flat-batted cover drive, positioning himself beside the ball to hit inside out, the head staying so very low, and right over the ball to give him the balance he needs to pull off that shot
quick hands as Rahane pulls off a flick when a good length ball on middle and leg looks for lbw
stands tall behind a shortish delivery on off stump and punches it to long-on
nice and full outside off, Rahane defends
presses forth to the pitch of the ball on leg stump and clips it through midwicket.
hangs back against the googly on leg stump and when it turns into him, those wrists send the ball scurrying to the long leg boundary
invites the cover drive and Kohli is never one to turn it down.
fullish on middle at 139 kph, Kohli defends

nearly rolls onto the stumps! And there's the possibility of a run-out as well! Kohli finds himself in the firing line of a short delivery on leg stump. He chops it down, looking for a quick single, but has to stop to make sure the ball rolls past his sticks. In that time, the single becomes a no-go and Rahane communicates that appropriately
superb pull shot, getting on top of the bounce and rolling his wrists to keep it down. And this isn't a dibbly dobbly bouncer. It's coming up at his throat
another fast, fierce bouncer at 143 kph. Rahane looks a little awkward as he pulls to deep square leg
nudges a good length ball through midwicket
141kph, walks at the fast bowler, who digs it in short again. Kohli swivels on the pull and finds a single to long leg
seems to be the slider, which Kohli easily negotiates with a front foot drive to long-off. Brings up his fifty
flatter delivery on and around off stump, Rahane backs away and tries to force it thorugh the off side, but can't beat Tahir

comes down the track for a whip down the ground - Tahir stretches to his right, having to turn away from his followthrough and can't reach far enough. Even if he'd gotten a finger to it, and the ball had ricocheted onto the stumps, Kohli might have been run out
works the ball on middle and leg to short fine leg
comes forward to block into the covers and they sprint through for a quick single
full toss on off stump, Kohli finds a run at mid-on
waits on the short ball outside off and gently taps it on top of the bounce to deep third man
extends the back-foot defence, and opens the face a touch so that he can beat short cover diving to his left
rides the bounce as he upper cuts a short and wide delivery to deep third man
angles it into the base of middle stump but Kohli rarely fails against that line. Flicks it strongly to through midwicket and bullies Rahane into taking a second.
keeps low as Kohli loads up a pull to a short and wide delivery and is beaten
gets to the pitch of the flighted delivery outside off and nudges it to long-on
looks to find the gap between point and short third man, but the length is just a touch too full for that. Kohli still utters a grunt of frustration
full on off stump, drives to long-off
backs away to try and pull a short ball on off stump, but it's a good job he corrects himself and looks to hit straight, because this skids off the pitch. Single to long-on
another loud grunt because he has hit a short and wide delivery straight to point
shimmies down the pitch and nails a full delivery on middle to long-on
extra bounce as Kohli comes charging out of his crease for a flay over point and is beaten.
steers a back of a length delivery on off stump to point
slices a shortish delivery through to the sweeper and Kohli runs through for the second as well. Morkel is a little lax out there
inside edges a flick towards square leg and shows the umpire that he'd got some bat for good measure
blocks a shortish delivery past the right of the non-striker
short ball, which doesn't quite rise enough, Kohli pulls it to deep backward square leg
cuts the slightly short and wide delivery to deep point
reads the googly out the hand and punches it down to long-on. That's the ball a less careful batsman might have cut and been bowled
full and outside off, Kohli drives through cover
low full toss on off stump, drives to long-on
googly again, which Kohli has no trouble sending down to long-on
flicks a quicker, flatter delivery to short midwicket
works a back of a length delivery to short midwicket

'push, push, push, push, push,' Kohli yells after flicking a ball, which is rising even as it reaches him, away to the left of long leg. Splendid contact, rising up off his feet to get on top of the bounce
fuller delivery outside off, drives to mid-off
sets up for the on the up drive again but finds du Plessis at cover
opens the face in search of a single behind point, but there is nothing on offer with both he and short third man up
strays down leg and Kohli pulls it gleefully to the long leg boundary. Too easy.
launches it over midwicket to celebrate the hundred partnership, which came up last ball. Races out of his crease and swipes it away. Tells what he thinks about the threat of Tahir
fuller delivery outside off, defends
tosses it up on off stump, Rahane blocks
gets too close to the ball as he advances down the pitch and as such he can't get any power in his drive down the pitch
premeditates a sweep, and even with Tahir bowling flat and quick, he pulls off the shot for a couple to long leg
full and outside off, he drives to cover
straightens off the pitch and beats the set batter. Even with Kohli walking at him, he goes to pitch the ball up and gets substantial movement
shortish and outside off, Kohli guides it to point
dabs a shortish delivery meant to cramp him towards point and gets a single
width on offer and Rahane slashes it to sweeper cover
though the short ball is rising up on middle and leg, Kohli positions himself such that he still has room to tap it through to deep point
short and outside off, Rahane decides to let it go
floated full outside off, misses out on the cover drive. Carves to point
good length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
doesn't make the connection he wants. Steps out and is beaten in flight as this drifts away. Might have been looking to go midwicket initially. Ends up chipping towards deep extra cover
back of a length on middle stump, punched back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, steps out and connects on the drive across the lone but he can't beat Faf at midwicket. Parried to long-on.
back of a length on leg stump, whipped to deep square
back of a length on off stump, pushed through the square leg region with a closed face
offcutter, good length outside off. Dropped in front of point with soft hands
good length and into the body as he walks down. Nudges it straight to midwicket off the high end of the bat
hangs back this time in anticipation of the short ball. Gets it and clubs it to deep square with a hook
hooks uppishly and brings up his fifty with a boundary to deep square's right. Short ball climbing up at his ribs and he swivels to lift it into that long leg region
good length on leg stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease
tossed up wide outside off, driven hard to extra cover who doesn't gather cleanly
good length ball fired down leg side. Beats the bat and the keeper
back of a length on leg stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
dropped short and down leg side. Kohli pounces on it after getting on his knee. Slaps it to the long leg boundary
full outside off, steps out and jams it to long-off's right to come back for the second
full on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
Rahane in full glory. Stands tall to this full ball on leg stump and drills it past Kohli with disdain
length ball on middle stump, flicked to deep square's right and calls for the second
nearly chops on as he the ball doesn't rise outside off. Cut dribbles down to fine leg
short ball in the corridor, steers it to third man
full on leg stump, punches it straight to mid-on with a high elbow
good length outside off, keeps the front leg out of the way and looks to slap it through the covers. Mistimes and gets it out to extra cover who fumbles. No damage done
full on off stump, driven along the floor to long-off
tossed up outside off, leans in and drives to long-off
good length on off stump, defended into the off side on the front foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length on middle, defended on the front foot
full on middle stump, drives to long-on
short ball just outside off, waits on it and moves the weight back to chop this wide of third man
back of a length and in at leg stump. Thuds into the thigh guard as he looks to flick. Kohli is awake for the single
good length just outside off. Dabs it into the covers and steals a single
full and in at leg stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
oh what a shot! Length ball outside off. Stands tall and picks it up with a flat-batted slap over long-on. Stunning connection
full toss fired down leg side. He can't get bat on it

an angry Morris is having a terrible time running into Rahane's zen state right now. Drops it short in the corridor. The batsman has his head still, until the moment he has to arch it backwards to make room. Then the hands take over and he ramps this to the third man boundary
inside edge as he doesn't pick a googly and looks to drill this through the covers, away from the body
length outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
steps out and gets a short one. But he stays tall and pulls hard, straight to deep midwicket. Might have been a googly
good length on off stump, pushed into the off side on the front foot
length ball on middle stump, gets behind and whips to deep square
back of a length on off stump, taps it to long-on off the back foot
shot. Reaches out to this length ball wide outside off and flays it deliberately over point. He's attacked Andile every time he's up against him on this tour. No respite. The target's in sight
good length on middle stump, punched to long-on
slower ball, short of a length outside off. Pulls to midwicket's left. He parries it to long-on

hundred number 33! 20th in a chase. That makes it one every 5.6 innings in a chase. Let that sink in. Andile bowls a wide length ball again and this time Kohli spanks it on the up in front of cover. No stopping that
short ball on middle stump, swivels and steers to fine leg with a hook shot
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot

check that for legality. Cancel everything from before - this is the shot of the tour. Length ball outside off. Hardly any feet. Gets underneath it with his wrists and lifts it on the up, over extra cover. Ends with a flourish. Ridiculous.
good length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length and in at leg stump, flicked to deep square leg
good length outside off, dabbed through the gully region with soft hands
back of a length at leg stump, clipped behind square off the hips and a stolen second again. Might have been tight at the non-striker's end if Rabada had gone back to the stumps
full outside off stump. Drives uppishly, wide of the bowler. Can't beat mid-off to his right
good length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side from the crease
slower ball, back of a length on off stump. Flicked to midwicket on the up

lobs one for long-on. Length ball follows him down leg side. He goes for a pick-up over midwicket, but that gets too big on him. He ends up lifting a simple one for Tahir. A stunning knock from Rahane, if he ever needed one.
slower bouncer outside off. Looks to slap it through midwicket. It takes an eternity to come on. He under-edges into the off side

dropped. Zondo puts down a simple one after running in from deep square leg. Another slow bouncer from Andile. Kohli can't get above it once more. In fact, he gets too far under it. Hooks aerially and an easy one goes down in the deep
another bouncer. This one zooms past him. He's late on the hook
back of a length outside off, punched to extra cover on the up
good length outside off, punches it to mid-off's right on the up but can't beat Amla's slide
the most radical opening shot you'll see. Walks across and shows middle and leg. Picks the full ball and flicks to fine leg

looks like Shamsi has kicked the ball into play at fine leg. Kohli nails the hook and it's racing away to Shamsi's left at fine leg. Puts in a lunge and ends up volleying it to deep square leg. Wenger, sign him up!
good length on off stump, defended down the pitch
short ball down leg side, swivels and pulls to fine leg's left

full toss on leg stump. Looks to flick, misses. Appeal is turned down and it's being reviewed. Looks like that was going down but he was struck on the full so this will be interesting...replays confirm it was going down.

yet another slower bouncer. Yet another hoick under it. This time Rabada comes under it and snaps it up. Unlike Kohli to keep going after that, but Phehlukwayo's persistence has been rewarded. Nevertheless, it's a standing ovation for Kohli for yet another stunning second-innings knock
good length and in at leg stump. Misses on the flick again. Deflected in fine leg's region and they pinch a second
full outside off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
close shout for lbw is turned down. It's a full ball and he's locked himself as he looks to flick. It strikes him on the pads and it would have gone down
good length outside off, tapped into the covers off the front foot
full toss on off stump. Defended down the pitch
there's the win. Short ball in at middle stump. Watches it come on and shovels it through square leg with a short-arm action
